title: Linux column Command with Practical Examples
description: Explore the Linux column command and learn how to format tabular data, customize output, and apply practical examples to enhance your text processing skills.

meta.title: Linux column Command with Practical Examples
meta.description: Explore the Linux column command and learn how to format tabular data, customize output, and apply practical examples to enhance your text processing skills.
meta.keywords: Linux, column, command, text processing, data formatting, tabular data, command-line tools

verify.name: Verify the column command is used to format tabular data
verify.hint: Make sure you use the `column` command with the `-t` and `-s,` options to format the data in the `data.txt` file.

steps.title: Use Column to Format Tabular Data

verify.name: Verify the column command is used to format tabular data with various options
verify.hint: Make sure you use the `column` command with the `-t`, `-s,`, and `-o20` options to format the data in the `data.csv` file.

verify.name: Verify the column command is used to customize the output with various options
verify.hint: Make sure you use the `column` command with the `-t`, `-s$'\t'`, and `-o20` options to format the data in the `data.txt` file.
